intro: Echinopanax elatus, commonly known as the giant echinopanax, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its striking foliage, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant.
